title: Added a padding feature.
body:
### Padding feature
Can be used for applying padding to a PhotonImage in four different ways:
| `photon_rs::transform::padding_uniform` : Applies an uniform padding around the PhotonImage.|
|----|
|![t6_padded_uniform](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30759667/114052184-7255fe80-98ab-11eb-9cb8-9a6639b4af80.jpg)|

| `photon_rs::transform::padding_top` : Applies padding on the top side of a PhotonImage | `photon_rs::transform::padding_right` : Applies padding on the right side of a PhotonImage |
|------|------|
|![t6_padded_top](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30759667/114052333-9580ae00-98ab-11eb-95e3-f470b7628a9a.jpg)|![t6_padded_right](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30759667/114052384-a3363380-98ab-11eb-9ccf-ce9646912989.jpg)|

|  `photon_rs::transform::padding_left` : Applies padding on the left side of a PhotonImage. | `photon_rs::transform::padding_bottom` : Applies padding on the bottom side of a PhotonImage|
|---------|--------|
|![t6_padded_left](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30759667/114052580-c9f46a00-98ab-11eb-8981-80e50101f4e3.jpg)|![t6_padded_bottom](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30759667/114052627-d2e53b80-98ab-11eb-8802-567b4f007bc0.jpg)|

title: Added oil effect
body: A cool little `oil` effect that lets you turn a picture into an oil painting!

title: New Native Methods.
body:
This PR adds two new native methods to aid with Image Serialization and De serialization.

`open_image_from_bytes`

`save_image_to_bytes`

I have added appropriate Doc fixes for the same. 

Note:

I also removed references to `extern crate` as 2018 edition of Rust advises against their use.
https://doc.rust-lang.org/edition-guide/rust-2018/module-system/path-clarity.html

title: Fix: Halftone consisitency
body: This PR ensures that the `halftone` effect uses `&mut PhotonImage` instead of just `PhotonImage`

title: Add CI with github & actions-rs
body:
It seems there is no CI integration and although there is no actual feature request I though I would add it and open a discussion for it.

The `Cargo.toml` for workspace is there because the actions run from the main directory for the repository and can't run within a sub-folder (as far as I looked into it)

Another consideration would be to commit the `Cargo.lock` file with the exact locked version of dependencies

### TODOs:

- [x] Run `rustfmt` - to fix all formatting
- [x] Fix `clippy` errors - primarily unused imports from what I see
- [ ] ~add Cargo.lock?!~

title: Feature request: panic-free functions
body:
For `open_image` the underlying `image` crate actually returns an `enum ImageError` (https://docs.rs/image/0.23.10/image/error/enum.ImageError.html) with errors ranging from an IO error to size, support, etc.

For `save_image` I thought it's more appropriate to have an enum and ask if the `Option` from the `ImageBuffer::from_vec` call should be still `unwrap()`ed or handled with an error as it is now.

1. `struct OpenError` - with `#[transparent]` the `source` of the Error & `impl Display` are delegated to `ImageError` + an implementation of `From<ImageError>` with `#[from]`
2. `enum SaveError` - with `transparent` the `source` of the Error & `impl Display` are delegated to the `std::io::Error`


I am not sure if they should be left like this so feedback is welcome.

### TODOs:

1. Find all places of `open_image` and handle the `Result`
2. Find all places of `save_image` and handle the `Result`
3. Make the doc comments compile. Currently the `img.jpg` file doesn't exist and all the doc tests fail. How should we add this image and is there a test image we can use?

title: Auto format the code with cargo & validate format during build

title: Round benchmark time taken display to 2 decimal places
body:
I noticed the benchmark time display wasn't rounded, causing the final digits and `ms` text to be cut off sometimes.

![A screenshot of the demo page showing a benchmark time value of 20.88999981060624 milliseconds exactly](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5085260/84187166-f07e2480-aa91-11ea-86dd-a8a4c38a4d49.png)

This PR makes the time display round to 2 decimal places using [`Number.toFixed()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/toFixed).

![A screenshot of the demo page showing a rounded benchmark time value of 27.86 milliseconds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5085260/84187245-10154d00-aa92-11ea-9c05-c66d9b689e1c.png)


The choice of 2 digits is a bit arbitrary but it seems like good enough precision to still get the point across 🚀

looks like problem was because `new_from_byteslice` was not converting image to rgba before storing in `raw_pixels`

title: Fixed #18 - blend() shifts colors
body:
Hi Silvia,

Here is fix for issue #18, the problem was - color first loaded as linear srgba, and then after blending saved as nonlinear srgba

title: add experimental fast gaussian blur
body: Hi Silvia, I tried to implement a linear-time approximate Gaussian blur algorithm following the introduction to this [link](http://blog.ivank.net/fastest-gaussian-blur.html ). Probably it could be a good complement of current blur functions. I also wrote a very simple benchmark test based on crate `criterion` (I added it under `dev-dependencies`). The file is in `benches` and you could just run `cargo bench` to see results. The benchmark only tested two images (`daisies_fuji.jpg` and `underground.jpg`) in `examples` and it showed some performance improvement as follows (hope I didn't make common benchmark mistakes = =): ``` Running target/release/deps/photon_benchmark-6b32e3e6318ed175 Gnuplot not found, using plotters backend Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/fast_gaussian_blur/0: Warming up for 3.0000 s Warning: Unable to complete 50 samples in 5.0s. You may wish to increase target time to 25.8s or reduce sample count to 10. Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/fast_gaussian_blur/0: Collecting 50 samples in estimated 25.773 s (1275 itera Gaussian Blur/fast_gaussian_blur/0 time: [19.721 ms 20.272 ms 20.834 ms] change: [+10.427% +13.307% +15.953%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05) Performance has regressed. Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/fast_gaussian_blur/1: Warming up for 3.0000 s Warning: Unable to complete 50 samples in 5.0s. You may wish to increase target time to 64.4s or reduce sample count to 10. Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/fast_gaussian_blur/1: Collecting 50 samples in estimated 64.365 s (1275 itera Gaussian Blur/fast_gaussian_blur/1 time: [49.807 ms 50.403 ms 50.978 ms] Found 2 outliers among 50 measurements (4.00%) 2 (4.00%) high mild Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/normal_gaussian_blur/2: Warming up for 3.0000 s Warning: Unable to complete 50 samples in 5.0s. You may wish to increase target time to 56.3s or reduce sample count to 10. Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/normal_gaussian_blur/2: Collecting 50 samples in estimated 56.258 s (1275 ite Gaussian Blur/normal_gaussian_blur/2 time: [41.887 ms 42.543 ms 43.260 ms] Found 2 outliers among 50 measurements (4.00%) 1 (2.00%) low mild 1 (2.00%) high mild Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/normal_gaussian_blur/3: Warming up for 3.0000 s Warning: Unable to complete 50 samples in 5.0s. You may wish to increase target time to 135.6s or reduce sample count to 10. Benchmarking Gaussian Blur/normal_gaussian_blur/3: Collecting 50 samples in estimated 135.59 s (1275 ite Gaussian Blur/normal_gaussian_blur/3 time: [103.38 ms 105.28 ms 106.84 ms] Found 5 outliers among 50 measurements (10.00%) 5 (10.00%) low mild ``` Average processing time reduces from 42.543 ms to 20.272 ms, and 105.28 ms to 50.403 ms for `daisies_fuji.jpg` and `underground.jpg`, respectively (but variance a little bit high). Here are some examples: **underground.jpg with `radius=10`:** ![raw_image_03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11512033/76524355-e2296800-64a4-11ea-9abf-e1ddabde0c6c.png) And the difference with standard Gaussian blur in Affinity Photo: **daisies_fuji.jpg with `radius=5`:** ![raw_image_04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11512033/76524938-ea35d780-64a5-11ea-8347-9af2989ec050.png) The difference with standard Gaussian blur in Affinity Photo: I am looking forward to any advice.

title: add contrast
body:
Hi @silvia-odwyer 

Just implemented a very simple contrast adjustment function for RGBA image. I think there must be some much better algorithm, for example, when adjust factor is very close to boundaries (-255.0, 255.0). Hopefully this implementation could be a good start point for you and other developers.

Any advice is welcomed.

title: Invert and mix colour
body:
Hi Silvia,

Not sure if `invert` and `mix_with_colour` functions would be useful for this project. Any suggestions are welcomed (code style, implementation, etc.).

title: add wasm constructor for Rgb struct
body:
Hi Silvia,

just wondering if it was okay to just add `#[wasm_bindgen(constructor)]` to Rgb struct. Then we are able to create an Rgb object in JS like `new module.Rgb(r, g, b)`. For now it's likely we can't pass parameters to constructor. If we call functions such as `set_red` afterwards, a null pointer error raises (`Javascript Error:  Error: null pointer passed to rust`). Tested on Chrome 79.0.3945.88, with latest codes from master branch.

title: Enhancement: choosing FilterType in resize functions #6
Added transform module, which contains cropping and flipping functions. Partially fixes Issue #3
body:
Implemented the cropping and flipping of images (both vertically and horizontally). This partially fixes Issue #3. 

Their corresponding functions have been placed within the `transform` module; this module will contain extra functions such as scaling/rotating/resizing of images in the future. 

However, design decisions may change the current implementation, and several changes in the design may be required before merging to master.
